oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The first vote
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An illustration from Harper's Weekly showing a queue of African-American men. The first man is dressed as a laborer and is casting his vote, the second is dressed as a businessman, the third is wearing a Union Army uniform, and the fourth appears to be dressed as a farmer.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Waud, Alfred R. (Alfred Rudolph), 1828-1891
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Voting; Freedom; Ballot boxes; Suffrage; Queues
